private_information: I am allowed to move disks A B C D E F G H
I can move only the smallest eight disks: A is the smallest, H is the eighth smallest
agent_1.goal: Achieve the goal configuration where left peg has top to bottom B C D E F G H I J K L M N O, middle peg is empty, and right peg has A

private_information: I am allowed to move disks I J K L M N O
I can move only the largest seven disks
agent_2.goal: Achieve the goal configuration where left peg has top to bottom B C D E F G H I J K L M N O, middle peg is empty, and right peg has A

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' primitive moves and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward planner that encodes the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and the global goal

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with pegs named left middle right
Disk labels A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O ordered A smallest through O largest
Initial configuration left peg top to bottom A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O, middle empty, right empty
Goal configuration left peg top to bottom B C D E F G H I J K L M N O, middle empty, right top to bottom A
Rules: only move the top disk of any peg
Rules: you cannot place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
Agents are constrained to move only specific disks: agent_1 can move disks A through H, agent_2 can move disks I through O

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi solution. You are allowed to move only disks A B C D E F G H. You should produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Use the exact format agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2 for each move. Do not emit PDDL. Obey Tower of Hanoi rules: only move top disks and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Base your moves on the public information and your private disk permissions. If you have no moves to perform, output an empty list.
moves.prompt: You are agent_1. Public information is available in the environment. Your private information is your allowed disks. The global goal is to reach the target configuration with disk A on the right and the remaining disks on the left in order. Provide the minimal ordered list of primitive moves you will execute, each on its own line in the required format agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi solution. You are allowed to move only disks I J K L M N O. You should produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Use the exact format agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2 for each move. Do not emit PDDL. Obey Tower of Hanoi rules: only move top disks and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Base your moves on the public information and your private disk permissions. If you have no moves to perform, output an empty list.
moves.prompt: You are agent_2. Public information is available in the environment. Your private information is your allowed disks. The global goal is to reach the target configuration with disk A on the right and the remaining disks on the left in order. Provide the minimal ordered list of primitive moves you will execute, each on its own line in the required format agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning targeting the FastDownward planner. You must produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode this two-agent Tower of Hanoi instance. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The domain must include distinct actions for the two agents, for example move_agent_1 and move_agent_2, with preconditions and effects that enforce Tower of Hanoi rules and that restrict which disks each agent can move. The problem must encode the initial state and the global goal. Ensure the output is compatible with FastDownward. Integrate the primitive move lists provided by the agents and keep all agent actions distinct.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Here are the primitive move lists from the agents. Integrate them and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownward. Keep agent actions distinct and ensure the domain enforces that only permitted agents can move their assigned disks and that larger disks cannot be placed on smaller disks. Provide the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Moves from agent_1: {moves_agent_1} Moves from agent_2: {moves_agent_2}
